Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 11 for SLE 15 SP3)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 11 for SLE 15 SP3)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 5.3.18-59_40 fixes several issues.

The following security issues were fixed:

- CVE-2022-0435: Fixed remote stack overflow in net/tipc module that validate domain record count on input (bsc#1195308).
- CVE-2021-4083: Fixed a read-after-free memory flaw inside the garbage collection for Unix domain socket file handlers when users call close() and fget() simultaneouslyand can potentially trigger a race condition (bnc#1194460).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 15 SP3

Vulnerabilities.Description: A read-after-free memory flaw was found in the Linux kernel's garbage collection for Unix domain socket file handlers in the way users call close() and fget() simultaneously and can potentially trigger a race condition. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system or escalate their privileges on the system. This flaw affects Linux kernel versions prior to 5.16-rc4.

A stack overflow flaw was found in the Linux kernel's TIPC protocol functionality in the way a user sends a packet with malicious content where the number of domain member nodes is higher than the 64 allowed. This flaw allows a remote user to crash the system or possibly escalate their privileges if they have access to the TIPC network.
